# Background

- Morphological data collected on Common Loons (*Gavia immer*) from three regions in North America.

```{r, echo=FALSE, out.width="500px"}
knitr::include_graphics("loon.jpg")
```

- Data in `Loon1.csv` on the [MTH107 Data Page](http://derekogle.com/NCMTH107/resources/data_107).

---

# Background

- Data are loaded directly from the webpage into `loon`.

```{r load, cache=TRUE}
loon <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/NCData/master/Loon1.csv")
head(loon)
```

--

- Variables are:
  - **region**: general region of capture (Canada, NewEngland, USOther)
  - **state**: state or province of capture
  - **sex**: sex of bird (Female, Male, Unknown)

---

# Background

- Data are loaded directly from the webpage into `loon`.

```{r cache=TRUE}
<<load>>
```

- Variables are:
  - **bill.len**: bill length (mm)
  - **bill.wid**: bill width (mm)
  - **bill.dep**: bill depth (mm)
  - **bill.overlap**: amound upper bill overlaps lower bill (mm)

---

# Background

- Data are loaded directly from the webpage into `loon`.

```{r cache=TRUE}
<<load>>
```

- Variables are:
  - **culmen**: size of culmen (mm)
  - **weight**: weight (g) of bird
  - **tarsus**: length (mm) of tarsus (some values are average of left and right tarsus measurements)


---

```{r scatter, include=FALSE, fig.width=5, fig.height=5}
p <- ggplot(data=loon,
            mapping=aes(x=tarsus,y=weight)) +
  geom_point()
```
